sentences: "Ma viskan su vankrilt maha ..." – "Etse viska! Ptruu!"
"Aga teistel on vara ja sellepärast tuleb vaenlane." – "Etse tulgu! Kes käsib neil vara koguda."
context: The word 'viska' in Estonian appears to mean 'throw' or similar action of casting or throwing something. It is used in contexts where someone is instructed to throw something away or cast something off. In the example sentences, it's used with an imperative sense as 'viska!' meaning essentially 'throw!' or 'cast it away!'. The word seems to be related to the physical action of throwing objects.
